Posts.Content: Jun 19, 2009 10:24AM SylviaSoo wrote: From my experience (I'm only 25) it is overwhelming at first, but you learn to take it day by day! I had a biopsy done that came back positive. Then they did a sentinel lymph biopsy and removed 4 lymph nodes found out cancer had spread to two of them. Then I had a mastectomy and 11 more lymph nodes removed. Before I went into chemotherapy I had a bunch of scans done to my body ... bone scan, heart scan, etc. It'll be a lot of tests, but she'll get through it, especially with love and support from family. :)
Posts.Title: Confused and lost Alyxia SylviaSoo

Posts.Content: Jun 19, 2009 10:25AM SylviaSoo wrote: Just be there for your mom and kinda of "sense" what she would like you to do. Everyone reacts differently and sometimes "we" want to talk about it, sometimes we don't. It changes every day :) I have a blog you can check it out on my profile. Take care!
Posts.Title: Confused and lost Alyxia SylviaSoo
